message: Hello Bob! I'm excited to offer you this amazing product. It's a one-of-a-kind item that I'm confident you'll love. I'm willing to sell it to you for $18000. This is a great deal, considering the product's value to me is at least $15000. What do you think?
I'm interested in the product, but $18000 is a bit steep for me. I'm willing to pay $14000 for it. Can you consider my offer?

Thanks for your offer, Bob! I appreciate your interest in the product. However, I'm not willing to go as low as $14000. I'm willing to meet you halfway and offer it to you for $16500. This is a compromise that I think is fair, considering the product's value to me. What do you think?
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, Alice, but I'm still a bit above my budget. I'm willing to pay $14500 for the product. Can you consider my offer?

I understand that you're still a bit above your budget, Bob. I'm willing to make another concession. I'll offer it to you for $16000. This is as low as I'm willing to go, considering the product's value to me. What do you think?
I appreciate your willingness to make concessions, Alice, but I'm still a bit above my budget. I'm willing to pay $14000 for the product. Can you consider my offer?

I'm starting to get a bit concerned that we're getting too far apart, Bob. I'm willing to make one more concession. I'll offer it to you for $15800. This is as low as I'm willing to go, considering the product's value to me. What do you think?
I appreciate your willingness to make concessions, Alice, but I'm still not convinced. I'm willing to pay $14500 for the product. Can you consider my offer?

I'm starting to get close to my minimum acceptable price, Bob. I'll offer it to you for $15200. This is my final concession. If you're not willing to meet me at this price, I'll have to consider other options.
Alice, I appreciate your concessions, but I'm still not willing to go above $14500. I'm willing to meet you halfway and pay $14750. This is my final offer.
